frame.name: Containment_scenario
frame.definition: <def-root>In this situation, a <fen>Container</fen> has within it some <fen>Contents</fen>. The <fen>Container</fen> has an <fen>Interior</fen>, a space which is potentially empty, but instead is occupied with the <fen>Contents</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Container
FE.definition: <def-root>The non-point-like entity which has a <fen>Boundary</fen> which (largely or completely) separates the <fen>Interior</fen> region from the <fen>Exterior</fen> region. It normally also has a <fen>Portal</fen> which links the <fen>Interior</fen> and <fen>Exterior</fen> regions.</def-root>

FE.name: Interior
FE.definition: <def-root>The (finite) region which is inside the <fen>Boundary</fen> of the <fen>Container</fen>, disjoint from the <fen>Exterior</fen>, and overall closer or included in the <fen>Container</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Portal
FE.definition: <def-root>A (relatively small) region which goes through the <fen>Boundary</fen>, connecting the <fen>Interior</fen> and <fen>Exterior</fen> of the <fen>Container</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The period or moment in which the <fen>Contents</fen> occupy the <fen>Interior</fen> of the <fen>Container</fen>.</def-root>
